subject: The upcoming "assert" keyword in JDK 1.4
msgSnippet: Preliminary research by me and co-workers indicates that Sun is adding an assertion facility to JDK 1.4.  If this happens the way it says in the documentation,
messageBody:
Preliminary research by me and co-workers indicates that Sun is adding an
assertion facility to JDK 1.4. If this happens the way it says in the
documentation, "assert" will become a reserved keyword in the Java language.
Here is the Sun page detailing the new assertion facility:
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4/docs/guide/lang/assert.html
Note that it seems this is already in the beta of JDK 1.4.

The document also details ways of turning off assertions, including the fact
that you must use a special setting at compile time in order
for assertions to work at all:
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4/docs/guide/lang/assert.html#compiling

The question is whether not using this compile-time setting frees up the
"assert" keyword for use as a method name. My fear is that it
does not.

This could definitely cramp our style, to put it mildly. Anyone know any
more about this issue?

Thanks,
Noah Green



Noah Green
Software Engineering Manager
ThinAirApps, Inc.
